title: A second series of Curious storied traditions of Scottish life
author: Leighton, Alexander
snippet: Yet she trudged and trudged on, shuttingher mouth against her empty stomach to keep outthe cold north wind. She is at the foot of Inverleith Row, and her face is to the west; she willnow escape the desultory blasts by keeping closeby the long running dyke. She passes the scene

title: A second series of Curious storied traditions of Scottish life
author: Leighton, Alexander
snippet: They were now upon the low road leading parallel to the beach, and towards the end of Inverleith Row. Nor had the devil left them with thedeserted toddy-bowl.
